details.title: 'We will continue the fight till we get land of birthplace back'
details.content: The Dharma Sabha commenced with a speech from Vishwa Hindu Parishad's Vice President Champat Rai. He said that this huge congregation comes after 26 years of the Babri Masjid demolition.
Several saints and seers who have come for the event, are addressing the gathering one by one

<iframe width="100%" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tiUey0MwtYs" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>
VHP VP Champat Rai went on to say: We appeal to Muslim parties to take their claim over disputed land back.
RSS pracharak and a businessman based in Pratapgarh Siyaram Gupta has donated a cheque of Rs 1 crore to VHP for temple construction.
The saints give a call to bring the law through parliament to make way for temple construction.

details.title: Shiv Sena has no role in temple movement: UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya
details.content: Earlier today, The UP Deputy CM disapproved of the Shiv Sena's push for constructing a Ram temple in Ayodhya, saying the party had no role in the temple movement. Read more
Mahant Parmanand attacks Kapil Sibal in his speech for urging the Supreme Court to delay the decision on temple issue.

Krishna Gopal Sahsanghsahkary in his address while picking up threads from the 1992 temple movement said, "temple was connected with life and death of Hindus. It's just a symbolic congregation which expresses that hindus can go to any extent for the temple cause."

The temple was demolished four times before 1992, but they could not break the determination of the Hindu society. Whatever the saints decide for the temple construction, the RSS will abide by it, Krishna Gopal further added.

Senior Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge while attacking the Shiv Sena said, "Everyone's going there due to elections.Who stopped Uddhav Thackeray from going there in past 4-5 years? On one hand, they're friends with BJP and on the other they want to tell people they're interested in constructing the Ram temple and are pressurising the government. People won't be befooled."

Ayodhya has been divided into zones. Security scheme has been implemented. Red zone and yellow zone are two main security zones. State govt, state police and administration are committed to uphold the directions by the Supreme Court and High Court: ADG (law and order) Anand Kumar pic.twitter.com/rAfKIfERpe

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) November 25, 2018

Heavy deployment of Central Armed Police Forces, Provincial Armed Constabulary, Anti-Terrorism Squad has been done. Drone cameras being used to assess crowd. Thirteen parking spots have been designated, 2000 buses from various places have come to Ayodhya: ADG to ANI
Meanwhile, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat will address VHP's 'hunkar rally' in Nagpur over the Ram Temple matter later in the day, reports ANI.

The saints at the Dharma Sabha exhort activists to create public awareness about constructing the Ram Temple. "We will have to identify those who were putting obstacles in the path of temple construction," they say further asking people to write to the apex court to get the order expedited, reports TNIE correspondent from Lucknow Namita Bajpai.
Mahamandelshwar Parmanand Maharaj seeks an ordinance for temple construction and urges Muslim parties to hand over the land to Hindus for peaceful coexistence.
Shiv Sena on Sunday said that re-alliance with BJP for 2019 general elections will happen only if the Modi government takes 'concrete' steps for the construction of Ram temple in Ayodhya.

Congress appealed to the Supreme Court to postpone the Ayodhya hearing because of 2019 elections: PM Modi in Alwar [FULL STORY]


Prime Minister Narendra Modi during an election rally. (File photo | PTI)
The gathered seers and saints reposed faith in the government of the day and exhorted the Prime Minister to do whatever was needed to build the temple without waiting for the court order.

Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party (Lohia) chief Yadav said he urged the Uttar Pradesh governor to ensure that the law and order is maintained at all costs so that a repeat of what happened in 1992 is avoided. [READ HERE]

details.title: Congress leader Kapil Sibal responds to PM's claim over delayed Ayodhya verdict
details.content:
I've not appeared in SC b/w Jan-Nov'18. When matter came up in October, CJI said this is not priority. So, does PM have courage to make statement against judiciary. This only shows PM wants to rake this up for purposes of election, for making political capital out of it: K Sibal pic.twitter.com/CPuogELJ7e

— ANI (@ANI) November 25, 2018

details.title: Ram temple construction not a political issue: Fadnavis
details.content:
Expressing hope that Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray, who is in Ayodhya, would get the blessings of Lord Ram, Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis said that the Sena, which is its ally at the Centre and in Maharashtra, will remain its partner for the Maharashtra and the Lok Sabha polls due next year.

"The construction of Ram temple in Ayodhya is not a political issue. Shri Ram is the deity for entire India, Thackeray would get his blessings too," Fadnavis told reporters at Karad in Maharashtra's Satara district. [PTI]
Ramji Das of Nirmohi Akhara said: "The date for construction of the Ram temple will be declared in the 2019 Kumbh which will be held in Prayagraj".
Ramji Das of Nirmohi Akhara said: "The date for construction of the Ram temple will be declared in the 2019 Kumbh which will be held in Prayagraj". [READ HERE]
Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad said he will visit the temple town on Monday to urge the authorities to ensure that the rule of law prevails. [READ MORE]
